summary: This bill, the Seniors in the Workforce Tax Relief Act, proposes an above-the-line tax deduction for individuals aged 65 or older. The deduction amount is $25,000, reduced based on adjusted gross income (AGI) exceeding $100,000 (with different thresholds for joint filers and those with both spouses over 65). The deduction is allowed regardless of whether the individual itemizes other deductions and is scheduled to terminate after December 31, 2029.
